alert.note: Alert for Grant; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:39AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN GRANT AND OWEN COUNTIES THROUGH 615 AM EDT... At 539 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Owenton, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Owenton, Corinth, Monterey, Gratz, Elk Lake, Beechwood, Harmony, Long Ridge, Natlee, Eagle Hill, New Liberty, Twin Bridges, Squiresville, Keefer, Needmore, New Columbus, Holbrook, Elmer Davis Lake and Lawrenceville. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 144 and 150. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
